aws::graph::propositions: # International Business Competition and Regulatory Challenges
Amazon faces intensifying competition in international physical retail.
Amazon faces intensifying competition in international e-commerce retail.
Amazon faces intensifying competition in international omnichannel retail.
Amazon faces intensifying competition in international cloud services.
Amazon faces intensifying competition in other international services.
Competition intensifies through adoption of evolving business models.
Local companies may have a substantial competitive advantage.
Local companies' competitive advantage comes from greater understanding of the local customer.
Local companies' competitive advantage comes from greater focus on the local customer.
Local companies' competitive advantage comes from more established local brand names.
The inability to hire sufficient required personnel may limit Amazon's international growth.
The inability to train sufficient required personnel may limit Amazon's international growth.
The inability to retain sufficient required personnel may limit Amazon's international growth.
The inability to manage sufficient required personnel may limit Amazon's international growth.
The People's Republic of China regulates Amazon's businesses in country through regulations.
The People's Republic of China regulates Amazon's affiliates' businesses in country through regulations.
The People's Republic of China regulates Amazon's operations in country through regulations.
The People's Republic of China regulates Amazon's affiliates' operations in country through regulations.
The People's Republic of China regulates Amazon through license requirements.
The People's Republic of China regulates Amazon's affiliates through license requirements.
India regulates Amazon's businesses in country through regulations.
India regulates Amazon's affiliates' businesses in country through regulations.
India regulates Amazon's operations in country through regulations.
India regulates Amazon's affiliates' operations in country through regulations.
India regulates Amazon through license requirements.
India regulates Amazon's affiliates through license requirements.
Regulations may restrict foreign investment in the internet sector.
Regulations may restrict operation of the internet sector.
Regulations may restrict foreign investment in IT infrastructure.
Regulations may restrict operation of IT infrastructure.
Regulations may restrict foreign investment in data centers.
Regulations may restrict operation of data centers.
Regulations may restrict foreign investment in retail.
Regulations may restrict operation of retail.
Regulations may restrict foreign investment in delivery.
Regulations may restrict operation of delivery.
Regulations may restrict foreign investment in other sectors.
Regulations may restrict operation of other sectors.
Regulations may restrict internet content.
Regulations may restrict the sale of media products.
Regulations may restrict the sale of media services.
Regulations may restrict the sale of other products.
Regulations may restrict the sale of other services.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/
/FORM 10-K/Part I/Item 1A - Risk Factors/Business and Industry Risks/

text:
As international physical, e-commerce, and omnichannel retail, cloud services, and other services grow, competition will intensify, including through adoption of evolving business models. Local companies may have a substantial competitive advantage because of their greater understanding of, and focus on, the local customer, as well as their more established local brand names. The inability to hire, train, retain, and manage sufficient required personnel may limit our international growth.

The Peoples Republic of China (PRC) and India regulate Amazons and its affiliates businesses and operations in country through regulations and license requirements that may restrict (i) foreign investment in and operation of the internet, IT infrastructure, data centers, retail, delivery, and other sectors, (ii) internet content, and (iii) the sale of media and other products and services.
